events.title: September 11 Attacks
events.description: Terrorist group al-Qaeda hijacked four planes, crashing two into the World Trade Center towers in New York City, one into the Pentagon, and the fourth in Pennsylvania, leading to nearly 3,000 deaths.
events.significance: Marked a pivotal moment in global security, leading to the War on Terror and major changes in U.S. and worldwide security policies.

events.title: Construction of the Pentagon begins
events.description: Construction started on the Pentagon, the headquarters of the United States Department of Defense, in Arlington, Virginia.
events.significance: Became a symbol of U.S. military power and one of the world's largest office buildings.

events.title: Mother Teresa dies
events.description: Mother Teresa, Nobel Peace Prize laureate and founder of the Missionaries of Charity, passed away.
events.significance: Her death marked the loss of a global humanitarian icon known for her work with the poor and sick.

events.title: The Bahamas gains independence
events.description: The Commonwealth of The Bahamas gained independence from the United Kingdom.
events.significance: Marked the emergence of The Bahamas as an independent nation within the Commonwealth.

events.title: Alexander Fleming discovers penicillin
events.description: Alexander Fleming publishes his discovery of penicillin, the first true antibiotic.
events.significance: Revolutionized medicine by introducing an effective treatment for bacterial infections, saving millions of lives.
